questions.question: Don’t let him ………………………….
questions.description: Let is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: She was not permitted ……………………….. to him.
questions.description: Permit is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: I saw them ………………………… the road.
questions.description: See can be followed by object + ing form or bare infinitive.

questions.question: I heard them …………………………. in the other room.
questions.description: Hear can be followed by object + ing form or bare infinitive.

questions.question: They encouraged me ………………………… another attempt.
questions.description: Encourage is followed by a to-infinitive.

questions.question: The teacher advised the students ……………………….. harder.
questions.description: Advise is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: The poor slaves were made ………………………… day and night.
questions.description: When make is used in its passive form, it is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: The cruel master made them ………………………… harder and harder.
questions.description: Make is followed by object + bare infinitive.

questions.question: I want you ……………………….. by evening.
questions.description: Want is followed by object + to-infinitive.
